author: Special Correspondent
text:
Five Superintendents of Customs, posted at Kempegowda International Airport, were caught red-handed by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) while they were accepting bribe.

They were netted in a drive on March 16 by the Anti-Corruption Bureau of CBI along with three touts who were collecting bribes from house agents to release imported goods from the Import Section of Customs, Air India Sats, Air Cargo Complex and Menezes Aviation Bobba Air Cargo Terminal.

The CBI team seized Rs. 75,000 from the touts, who were collecting money on behalf of the officials.

All the officials — Narasimha Swamy S.G, N. Sundaram, V. Visweswara Bhat, V. Prem Kumar and K.R. Somasunder — were arrested on Friday.

They will be produced before the CBI Special Court on Saturday.

GP member arrested

A gang of five, including a gram panchayat member, was arrested on Friday in connection with a kidnap case.

The accused in the case are Venkatesh Murthy, a GP member of Hulikere, his brother Prashanth and their friends Manjunath, Srikanta Sharma and Mohan.

The gang had, on Thursday, abducted Kumar and his employee Eshwar and kept them in a farm in Kottehalli. Eshwar was abducted when he came to the rescue of Kumar while the gang was bundling the latter into a car.

Loan

They were abducted to repay a loan of Rs. 20 lakh taken by Kumar’s brother, the police said.
title: Five customs officials held on bribery charge
